usage_notes: Use when meeting someone for the first time in the morning, or in very formal situations
cultural_notes: In East African cultures, greetings are very important and should not be rushed

usage_notes: Use with friends, close colleagues, or people you know well
cultural_notes: Can be shortened or made more casual among close friends

usage_notes: Affectionate morning greeting from parent to child
cultural_notes: Terms of endearment vary by culture and family

front: Hi honey/darling, how was your day?
back: ሰላም ፍቅሬ፣ ቀንሽ እንዴት ነበር? (selam fiqre, qensh indet neber?)
usage_notes: Affectionate evening greeting between romantic partners
cultural_notes: Shows care and interest in partner's day

front: Excuse me, could you please help me?
back: ይቅርታ፣ እባክዎ ሊረዱኝ ይችላሉ? (yiqirta, ibakwo lireduñ yichilalu?)
usage_notes: Polite way to ask for help from someone you don't know
cultural_notes: Always start with an apology/excuse me in most cultures

front: Hey, can you give me a hand?
usage_notes: Casual way to ask a friend for help
cultural_notes: Friends are expected to help each other readily

usage_notes: Use in any emergency situation regardless of who is around
cultural_notes: Shout loudly to attract attention in emergencies

usage_notes: Formal expression of gratitude to strangers or in professional settings
cultural_notes: Showing gratitude is highly valued in all East African cultures

usage_notes: Casual thanks to friends and people you know well
cultural_notes: Can be shortened among close friends

front: Excuse me, could I have some water, please?
back: ይቅርታ፣ እባክዎ ውሃ ማግኘት እችላለሁ? (yiqirta, ibakwo wiha maget ichilalewu?)
usage_notes: Polite way to request water in formal settings or from strangers
cultural_notes: Water is considered a basic right; most people will help

front: Got any water? / Can I get some water?
usage_notes: Casual way to ask for water from friends or family

front: Excuse me, where is the hospital, please?
back: ይቅርታ፣ ሆስፒታሉ የት ነው እባክዎ? (yiqirta, hospitalu yet new ibakwo?)
usage_notes: Polite way to ask for directions to hospital
cultural_notes: People will usually help with medical emergencies

front: I'd like to order lunch, please
back: እባክዎ ምሳ ማዘዝ እፈልጋለሁ (ibakwo misa mazez ifeliagalehu)
usage_notes: Standard phrase for ordering lunch at a restaurant
cultural_notes: Lunch is typically the main meal in many East African cultures
